revised_title: Biochemistry of Fluoroacetate Poisoning: Isolation and Properties of Fluorotricarboxylic Acid Inhibitor
tldr: Researchers isolated and studied a fluorotricarboxylic acid inhibitor of citrate metabolism from fluoroacetate poisoning. They found that the inhibitor, synthesized by enzymic action, significantly inhibits citric acid disappearance. The study provides evidence that the toxicity of fluoroacetate is due to the synthesis of a fluorotricarboxylic acid that disrupts the tricarboxylic acid cycle at the citrate stage.
